intro: Schoenoplectiella roylei, commonly known as the Himalayan bulrush, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine zones. Schoenoplectiella roylei plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms in its native habitat.
